description: Known as the Eleonora Cockatoo, this is a subspecies of the Greater Sulphur-Crested. It is smaller than the Greater but larger than the Lesser, with a crest that is not as forward-curving.
temperament: Highly intelligent, playful, and demanding. Their personality is a classic 'big cockatoo' temperament, requiring a lot of social interaction and mental stimulation.
loudness: Extremely Loud. They possess the full, ear-splitting screech of the Sulphur-Crested family and are not suitable for noise-sensitive environments.
vocalization: Can be excellent mimics of speech and sounds. However, they are more likely to use their natural scream to communicate.
dietaryNeeds: A low-fat pelleted diet is essential to prevent obesity and fatty liver disease. Provide a wide variety of fresh vegetables daily.
healthPointers: Can live 60-80 years. Very prone to behavioral issues like feather plucking and screaming if their needs for attention are not met. Produce significant feather dust.
housing: Not suitable for apartments. A very large and strong cage is required. Minimum size: 36"W x 24"D x 60"H.
